snippet: A European Union official said the bloc could suspend the requirement that non-E.U. airlines offset their emissions if progress were made toward establishing a global system.
abstract: European Union may suspend parts of a new law requiring airlines to account for their greenhouse gas emissions if countries make clear progress toward establishing a global emissions control system; comments are clearest sign yet that Europe is considering ways to defuse a mounting conflict over emissions laws with its most important trading partners.
lead_paragraph: A European Union official said the bloc could suspend the requirement that non-E.U. airlines offset their emissions if progress were made toward establishing a global system.

headline.seo: Airline Emissions System May Be Adjusted in Europe
headline.main: Airline Emissions Restraints May Be Relaxed in Europe
headline.print_headline: Airline Emissions Restraints May Be Relaxed in Europe
